titleStmt.title: A token of Christian love, in several sober considerations receiving the Holy Sacrament, which in holy Scripture is called, The Supper of the Lord. Most humbly and faithfully presented unto all sorts of Protestants for their comfort in a right receiving of it, and for prevention of those miseries that may follow the receiving of it unworthily. By James Jones citizen of London.
titleStmt.author: Jones, James, fl. 1683-1684.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Tho. Malthus at the Sun in the Poultrey,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
